document.docAuthor: Bai, Xiaoshuan, Heiss, Ernst & Cai, Wanzhi
document.docTitle: Paracremastaptera ximaensis Bai, Heiss & Cai 2020, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Paracremastaptera, a new apterous genus of Mezirinae from China (Hemiptera Aradidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Paracremastaptera, a new apterous genus of Mezirinae from China (Hemiptera Aradidae)

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Holotype :
³, China , Yunnan , Yingjiang County , Xima Town ,
2. X. 2019
, Surnaa & Qian, H. G. , leg. ( IMNU ). The specimen is provided with type label accordingly.

subSubSection.paragraph: Description. Male. Body blackish brown. Eyes reddish. Antennae and legs beset with dense hairs. Thorax and tergal plate deeply punctured.

Head. Wider across eyes than long (1.25: 0.75); clypeus strongly raised anteriorly, reaching basal fifth of first antennal segment; genae short, not reaching the apex of clypeus with a pair of knob-like tubercles basally; antenniferous lobes cup-like; antennae 1.48 times as long as width of head across eyes, length of antennal segments I to IV = 0.60: 0.30: 0.55: 0.40; eyes stalked, large, directed anterolaterally; postocular borders constricted posteriorly; vertex anteriorly with a median inverted triangular depression, a transvers carina behind clypeus, and posteriorly with a longitudinal strongly elevated granulate carina flanked by a pair of large, ovate infraocular granulate callosities; rostrum long, almost reaching to posterior margin of prosternum; rostral groove wide, deep, opened posteriorly.

Pronotum . 2.43 times as wide as long (1.7: 0.70); anterolateral borders slightly sinuate, oblique; anterior margin concave; disk transversally granulate and carinate anteriorly, followed posteriorly by a median T-shaped longitudinal groove flanked by a pair of subtriangular sclerites, laterad of groove with three large prominent tubercles on either side; lateral margins straight; posterior margin broadly convex, carinate, smooth.

Mesonotum. Wider than pronotum (2.1: 1.7); separated from pronotum by very deep furrows; median ridge with a pair of large round longitudinal tubercles flanked by punctured sclerites; disc narrow, broad, with a pair of prominent conical tubercles on either side.
Metanotum . Wider than mesonotum (2.3: 2.1); fused with mtg I+II and mesonotum, median ridge with a pair of large round longitudinal tubercles flanked by punctured sclerites.

Abdomen . Mtg I+II completely fused with tergal plate, median ridge with two short longitudinal carinae on mtg I and two oblique longitudinal carinae on the mtg II; tergal plate subquadrangular, posterior margin truncate, lateral margins slightly rounded, median pentagonal ridge highly raised on mtg IV, flanked by a pair of transverse short ridges on mtg III, then tapering posteriorly; laterad of median ridge with the usual pattern of large and small callous spots; deltg II–VII separated by fine sulci, lateral margins of deltg II–VII raised and carinate with pairs of pilose tubercles on posterior margin of each segment; pygophore sinuate posteriorly; paratergites VIII short and truncate.

Venter . Prosternum with a round pilose median elevation; meso- and metasterna fused to each other, separated from prosternum and mst I+II by a transverse sulcus; metathoracic scent gland evaporatoria prominent, straight and widely gaping, laterally visible from above; anterior margin of mst III–VI deeply pitted; mst VII with a prominent round tubercle at middle; spiracles II absent, III to VII placed on vltg III–VII, V–VII visible from above, VIII terminal.
Legs. Femora moderately incrassate, with trochanters separated; tibiae straight; protibial comb present; claws without pulvilli.

Measurements [ in mm, ³ (n=1) ] . Body length 4.75; maximal width of abdomen 2.5 length of head 0.75, width 1.25; length pronotum 0.70, width 1.7; width of mesonotum 2.1; width of metanotum 2.3; length of antennae 1.85.
Etymology: This specific name is named after the holotype locality.
